LearningTree

Interface LearningTreeADT

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LearningTree

    public interface LearningTreeADT
    Interface to define available methods, how they should be implemented, how each method should be used.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Kyle Jon Aure

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        void addNode(java.lang.String question,
             java.lang.String answer,
             int location)
        Use Case: Add a node when the tree has reached a point where it has guessed an answer but that answer in marked incorrect.
        Parameters:
        question - Yes or No question that will help the tree distinguish between the answer it guessed and the true answer.
        answer - True answer that will be added to the tree on the 'yes' branch of the new question.
        location - where failed answer can be found.
        require
        use addNode only when you have reached an answerNode (leaf).
        ensure
        previous answer Node will be copied, question node will be inserted at this location left child will be set to correct answer, and right child will be set in incorrect answer.

      • getNode

        LearningTreeNode getNode(int location)
        General Method: Returns node at a specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - where node exists. Root = 0;
        Returns:
        LearningTreeNode object is returned.
        require
        Node must exist at the location you specify.
        ensure
        If a node exits at that location it will be returned, otherwise null will be returned if no node exists.

      • setLeftChild

        int setLeftChild(LearningTreeNode leftChild)
        Use Case: When first creating a Learning Tree the left child of the root (first question) must be set.
        Parameters:
        leftChild - answer node.
        Returns:
        int location of left child.
        require
        leftChild node must be the (NO) answer to root, and this method should not be used once tree has been created.
        ensure
        First time playing this answer will be used for further learning

      • setRightChild

        int setRightChild(LearningTreeNode rightChild)
        Use Case: When first creating a Learning Tree the right child of the root (first question) must be set.
        Parameters:
        rightChild - answer node.
        Returns:
        int location of left child.
        require
        rightChild node must be the (YES) answer to root, and this method should not be used once tree has been created.
        ensure
        First time playing this answer will be used for further learning

      • getLeftChildKey

        int getLeftChildKey(int location)
        General Method: Returns location of left child based on location of parent.
        Parameters:
        location - integer location of parent (p)
        Returns:
        Integer location of left child (lc) lc = 2p+1
        require
        parent location must be non-negative
        ensure
        left child location will be returned

      • getRightChildKey

        int getRightChildKey(int location)
        General Method: Returns location of right child based on location of parent.
        Parameters:
        location - integer location of parent (p)
        Returns:
        Integer location of right child (rc) rc = 2p+2
        require
        parent location must be non-negative
        ensure
        right child location will be returned

      • getFileLocation

        java.lang.String getFileLocation()
        Gets file location this Learning Tree
        Returns:
        String absolute file location.
        require
        File location must be set prior to using this method. File location is set by using the saveData method.
        ensure
        File location will be returned and the file will exist at that location.

      • getSubject

        java.lang.String getSubject()
        Gets this learning tree's subject.
        Returns:
        String subject for this learning tree.
        require
        This learning tree must be initialized and contain a subject.
        ensure
        The subject for this learning tree will be returned.

      • saveData

        void saveData()
        Use Case: Save data of a newly created LearningTree
        require
        This learning tree must be initialized and contain a fileLocation.
        ensure
        File will be saved in a serialized format to be loaded lated. If a file with the same name already exists it will be overriden.

      • loadData

        void loadData()
        Use Case: Load data file into this LearningTree.
        require
        Make sure the user wants to perform this action as any unsaved data will be lost.
        ensure
        All previous unsaved data will be lost and new data will be loaded into this tree.
